scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: O sides, you are too tough;

line_text: Will you yet hold? How came my man i' the stocks?

scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: I pray you, father, being weak, seem so.

line_text: If, till the expiration of your month,

line_text: You will return and sojourn with my sister,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: Dismissing half your train, come then to me:

line_text: I am now from home, and out of that provision
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: Which shall be needful for your entertainment.

line_text: To wage against the enmity o' the air;

line_text: Necessity's sharp pinch! Return with her?

line_text: Our youngest born, I could as well be brought
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: To keep base life afoot. Return with her?
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: Persuade me rather to be slave and sumpter
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: To this detested groom.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: At your choice, sir.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: I prithee, daughter, do not make me mad:
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: I will not trouble thee, my child; farewell:
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: We'll no more meet, no more see one another:
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: But yet thou art my flesh, my blood, my daughter;
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: Or rather a disease that's in my flesh,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: Which I must needs call mine: thou art a boil,

line_text: A plague-sore, an embossed carbuncle,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: In my corrupted blood. But I'll not chide thee;
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: Let shame come when it will, I do not call it:

line_text: I do not bid the thunder-bearer shoot,

line_text: Nor tell tales of thee to high-judging Jove:
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: Mend when thou canst; be better at thy leisure:

line_text: I and my hundred knights.

scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: For those that mingle reason with your passion

line_text: From those that she calls servants or from mine?

line_text: We could control them. If you will come to me,--
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: For now I spy a danger,--I entreat you
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: To bring but five and twenty: to no more
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: Will I give place or notice.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: I gave you all--

line_text: And in good time you gave it.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: Made you my guardians, my depositaries;
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: But kept a reservation to be follow'd
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: With such a number. What, must I come to you

line_text: With five and twenty, Regan? said you so?

line_text: And speak't again, my lord; no more with me.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: Those wicked creatures yet do look well-favour'd,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: When others are more wicked: not being the worst
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: Stands in some rank of praise.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: I'll go with thee:
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: Thy fifty yet doth double five and twenty,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: And thou art twice her love.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: Hear me, my lord;
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: What need you five and twenty, ten, or five,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: To follow in a house where twice so many
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: Have a command to tend you?
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: What need one?
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: O, reason not the need: our basest beggars
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: Are in the poorest thing superfluous:
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: Allow not nature more than nature needs,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: Man's life's as cheap as beast's: thou art a lady;
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: If only to go warm were gorgeous,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: Why, nature needs not what thou gorgeous wear'st,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: Which scarcely keeps thee warm. But, for true need,--
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: You heavens, give me that patience, patience I need!
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: You see me here, you gods, a poor old man,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: As full of grief as age; wretched in both!
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: If it be you that stir these daughters' hearts
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: Against their father, fool me not so much
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: To bear it tamely; touch me with noble anger,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: And let not women's weapons, water-drops,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: Stain my man's cheeks! No, you unnatural hags,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: I will have such revenges on you both,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: That all the world shall--I will do such things,--
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: What they are, yet I know not: but they shall be
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: The terrors of the earth. You think I'll weep
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: No, I'll not weep:
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: I have full cause of weeping; but this heart
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: Shall break into a hundred thousand flaws,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: Or ere I'll weep. O fool, I shall go mad!
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: Let us withdraw; 'twill be a storm.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: This house is little: the old man and his people
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: Cannot be well bestow'd.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: 'Tis his own blame; hath put himself from rest,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: And must needs taste his folly.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: For his particular, I'll receive him gladly,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: But not one follower.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: So am I purposed.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: Where is my lord of Gloucester?
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: Follow'd the old man forth: he is return'd.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: The king is in high rage.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: Whither is he going?
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: He calls to horse; but will I know not whither.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: 'Tis best to give him way; he leads himself.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: My lord, entreat him by no means to stay.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: Alack, the night comes on, and the bleak winds
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: Do sorely ruffle; for many miles about
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: O, sir, to wilful men,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: The injuries that they themselves procure
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: Must be their schoolmasters. Shut up your doors:
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: He is attended with a desperate train;
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: And what they may incense him to, being apt
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: To have his ear abused, wisdom bids fear.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: Shut up your doors, my lord; 'tis a wild night:
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: My Regan counsels well; come out o' the storm.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line_text: Who's there, besides foul weather?
scene_title: SCENE I.  A heath.

line_text: One minded like the weather, most unquietly.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A heath.

line_text: I know you. Where's the king?
scene_title: SCENE I.  A heath.

line_text: Contending with the fretful element:
scene_title: SCENE I.  A heath.

line_text: Bids the winds blow the earth into the sea,
scene_title: SCENE I.  A heath.

line_text: Or swell the curled water 'bove the main,
scene_title: SCENE I.  A heath.

line_text: That things might change or cease; tears his white hair,
scene_title: SCENE I.  A heath.

line_text: Which the impetuous blasts, with eyeless rage,
scene_title: SCENE I.  A heath.

line_text: Catch in their fury, and make nothing of;
scene_title: SCENE I.  A heath.

line_text: Strives in his little world of man to out-scorn
scene_title: SCENE I.  A heath.

line_text: The to-and-fro-conflicting wind and rain.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A heath.

line_text: This night, wherein the cub-drawn bear would couch,
scene_title: SCENE I.  A heath.

line_text: The lion and the belly-pinched wolf
scene_title: SCENE I.  A heath.

line_text: Keep their fur dry, unbonneted he runs,
scene_title: SCENE I.  A heath.

line_text: And bids what will take all.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A heath.
